We are chatting with Ken Ehrlich, Executive Producer of the GRAMMY Awards in 10 min! Stay tuned! #TWIL #GRAMMYs
We are asking #GRAMMYs Executive Producer Ken Ehrlich Qs! @GRAMMYKen - How many years have you been working on the GRAMMY Awards? #TWIL
KE: I started producing the GRAMMY Awards in 1980. This will be my 33rd show as Producer. #TWIL
.@GRAMMYKen (KE) - What is one of your best memories from your first #GRAMMYs? #TWIL
KE: 1st favorite moment - Entering auditorium b/f my 1st GRAMMYs & thnkng it was a dream. 1 worklight on stage & the house half-lit.Magical.
KE: 2nd favorite moment - Pairing Streisand & Neil Diamond for 'you don't send me flowers.' A remarkable duet?my 1st 'GRAMMY Moment.' #TWIL
.@GRAMMYKen (KE) - One of the biggest moments you can remember? #TWIL
KE: Prince/Beyonce. Eminem/Elton. And Melissa Etheridge/Joss Stone - Melissa's 1st appearance after successful recovery from breast cancer
.@GRAMMYKen (KE) - What has been your proudest moment? #TWIL #GRAMMYs
KE: 1st 'in memoriam' we did w/Springsteen,Stevie VanZandt,Dave Grohl &Elvis Costello, performing 'London Calling' in tribute 2 Joe Strummer
.@GRAMMYKen (KE) - Which artist(s) have you worked with the most? #TWIL #GRAMMYs
KE: Several have appeared every so often. Dave Grohl is 1 of my favorites, Stevie Wonder always comes through,& of course Beyonce & Whitney!
.@GRAMMYKen (KE) - One of the most magical GRAMMY Moments (pairings)? #TWIL #GRAMMYs
KE: Last year's finale w/McCartney, Springsteen, Grohl & Walsh performing 'Abbey Road' finale.1st time ever. Historic & musically brilliant!
KE: Mash up w/Jay Z & Linkin Park performing 'numb', when McCartney joined for a verse chorus of 'Yesterday'. Simply amazing.
.@GRAMMYKen (KE) - What do you consider the best part of your job? #TWIL #GRAMMYs
KE: Working w/ remarkable, talented people, both on the artist side & behind the scenes, creating magic every year. There's nothing like it!
.@GRAMMYKen (KE) - Anything you are particularly looking forward to this year? #TWIL #GRAMMYs
KE: The class of ?13 - Fun, Ed Sheeran, Black Keys & returning artists Justin, Rihanna, Taylor, Carrie, Bruno, Sting, Alicia, Adam Levine.
Thanks again @GRAMMYKen! And to everyone else, don't forget to tune in this Sunday, Feb. 10th on @CBSTweet! #GRAMMYs
